website_summaries.verdict: A tried and true favorite that lives up to its name with an astonishing variety of kid-approved colors and character prints. Affordable quality from a trusted brand.
pros: Vivid colors and popular prints hold huge appeal for little people
Vacuum insulated stainless steel walls deliver reliable temperature control
Contents stay cold for up to 7 hours or hot for 5
One and a half cup capacity is ideal for hot meals while still being compact enough to fit in a lunch bag
cons: Some owners report that the seal pops off a little too easily

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't leak. Keeps food warm.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't leak. I pack at 7am and food is still warm at 1pm. The color seems a little darker than in pic, but not much, and not a big deal for me. We wanted something small to fit in kids back pack and this fits great. A little bigger around than a can of pop and a little shorter.
customer_reviews.author: brandam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hot food keeper (IF YOU PRIME IT FIRST)!!
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this for about a year now. I "prime" it before each use. (Pour boiling water in and let it sit for about 10 min) Then, I dump the water, give it a quick wipe with a clean towel to dry it, and fill with hot lunch.......mac-n-cheese, chicken nuggets, hamburger helper, soup, leftovers......it stays warm until my kids are ready to eat. A great tool to have if you don't want to send cold lunch every day. Note: If you put hot food in a cold container......the container will lech the heat out of your food. That is why you need to warm the container first with the boiling water. :)
customer_reviews.author: P Powell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thermos for my daughter , she started kindergarten and is such a picky eater. It's perfect ! It's not too big, not too small , not too wide just perfect. It also fits inside her lunch bag perfectly. She does have a hard time opening it but the teacher or her classmates (who ever sits next to her) helps her out. Overall, it's a great thermos and it does indeed keep her food hot IF YOU FOLLOW THE DIRECTIONS (fill and close with hot water for about 20mintues , empty the water out and add your food). It's also super easy to clean, I just hand wash it with some soap and water.
customer_reviews.author: MariaTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: MOLD.
customer_reviews.text: I previously rated this a five but have come back to amend after realizing that the lid cannot fully be cleaned and inside the lid, mold grows easily. I am not talking about the removable plastic seal, I’m talking about the upper circle. This is not a safe product if it cannot be properly cleaned. I’m super disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t keep food warm
customer_reviews.text: I am highly disappointed in the brand ‘Thermos ‘. The thermos was a pretty pink with the and just the right size. I put my heated food in it when making my lunch and 2 hours later my food was cold. If you are purchasing this product to keep your food hot you are wasting your money. I didn’t want to even rate it 1 star but I couldn’t post this without checking on a star.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Hill

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a young grade schooler
customer_reviews.text: My son loves the C-3P0 design. It holds enough Mac and cheese, pasta, and even cut up pancakes, for his lunch - he’s 6; a bigger kid might need a bit more. Based on a review, I fill the thermos with hot water while I heat up the food and make the rest of his lunch; dump the water and the thermos keeps his food hot until lunch time. I am SURE his lunchbox/backpack get tossed around after he leaves, but we haven’t had any leaks. Easy to clean and fits in a standard size PB Kids lunch box along with a juice box and a couple snacks. Photo next to a 12 oz can for scale.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Works great for lunches!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my two boys and they're a hit! I've been making mac n cheese in the morning around 7:45am, we prime the thermoses with boiling water for 5-10 minutes while the pasta cooks and both boys have reported that their mac n cheese is still warm at lunchtime (11:15 and 11:45). Would definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Karen M.

customer_reviews.title: Soup/chili doesn't stay above 140 degrees for even 3 hours
customer_reviews.text: I tested my thermos with both chili and soup. I preheated the thermos with boiling water for 5+ minutes, then I heated my soup/chili to 180-190 degrees. After 3 hours the temperature dropped to about 135 degrees (food danger zone is 40-140 degrees) then at 5 hours it was down to 125 degrees. I just didn't feel safe sending these to school with my kids who will have to store their food for a full 5 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish it kept food warmer
customer_reviews.text: Sadly I don't feel like these keep food as warm as I would like.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Smith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for lunch boxes
customer_reviews.text: This has been perfect for my sons lunch box. I put them in the dishwasher to clean each time. I always double check the rubber seal on the lid for leftover food particles left behind. I simply run a piece of towel or washcloth inside the rim of the seal to make sure it's dry so it doesnt grow mold or mildew. We use this thermos for chicken nuggets, mac and cheese, and chef boyrdee. The chef boyrdee stains the rubber seal, so I suggest washing it by hand or use a tiny bit of Clorox to clean it. For us, it's the perfect size for school lunches.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi R. Varner

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement for a damaged thermos. I have used this thermos twice for my kids' lunch. Once for soup & once for caserole. I pre-heated it for 15 minutes with boiling water & also heated the food before transferring. Both times my kids complained that their food was luke warm. The soup leaked. Not impressed. Will go back to the vacuum insulated version.
customer_reviews.author: LimanJu

customer_reviews.title: Not the best!!
customer_reviews.text: The purple thermos design is different from what is pictured on the listing! Also, I used these for the first time and they did NOT work. I boiled water and filled each funtainer with boiling water for 15 minutes, lid on. I then, placed 4-5 tyson dinosaur chicken nuggets inside. The container says it will stay warm for 5 hours, within 4 hours my children complained of cold food. I called Thermos Customer Service, the representative shared that the Thermos Funtainer is meant for only hot liquids such as soups. So, why is this even labeled as a funtainer, if you are limited on what to put inside for a child...
customer_reviews.author: michael bryce

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for lunches
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this! We have been able to put mac n cheese, chicken nuggets, and soup inside this for my daughters lunch and its always warm. We put the food in there between 7-8 and she eats at 12 and its still warm! So glad we bought it! Its also easy for her to open and super easy to clean. It can go in either the dishwasher or its so easy to clean we hand wash it sometimes also.
customer_reviews.author: Christinec6

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work as a bottle warmer - disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Highly disappointed in this Thermos. Planned on using it as my bottle warmer while out and about. I put in boiling water before leaving the house and water was only about 100 degrees less than 2 hours later. Needless to say it wasn’t warm enough to warm a bottle. Also Dr Browns wide mouth bottles were too big to fit in. Avant-garde did fit. Color was beautiful, didn’t leak, just didn’t keep water hot enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Emma B.

customer_reviews.title: Good way to keep food warm
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our five year old to keep his lunch warm while at summer camp. I boil water and let it sit in the thermos for ten minutes. I heat the food up hotter then normal before I place it in the thermos. He normally eats his lunch four to five hours after I have made it. Most days he comes home and tells me it is still warm. There have been a few times he has come home and told me his lunch was cold. We mostly use it for pizza rolls and pastas. I did try mini corn dogs and those become mushy. We have not tried keeping anything cold in it yet.
customer_reviews.author: SomeColoradoGuyandGal

customer_reviews.title: Did NOT keep NUGGETS hot
customer_reviews.text: The main reason I purchased this was to keep chicken nuggets hot for my kindergartener's lunch meal at school. Despite following the directions: (boiling hot water and placing it in the container with lid on for 10 minutes prior to adding piping hot nuggets...four hours later they were ICE COLD. I tried this another time just to be sure it wouldn't work. I did not even place the container in a lunch box as I wanted to test it out at home first. SO glad I did. Returning this. :(
customer_reviews.author: Julie Brugo

customer_reviews.title: Great for school lunches!
customer_reviews.text: Things I like about this thermos is the wide opening which makes it easy to eat out of, the size which fits perfectly in my daughters lunch bag, and the simplicity design which makes it easy to clean. The only thing that could possibly be viewed as a con is that it doesn’t hold the heat as well as other thermoses I’ve owned. My daughter actually prefers this since her soup isn’t super hot when lunch time rolls around. Her lunch bag is kept in a heated school though, so if you were somebody who worked outdoors without the luxury of having a heated place to store your lunch bag it would probably cool off too much by lunch time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: After 1 year of light use, started to leak - fixed
customer_reviews.text: Changed from 2 to star to 3. The seal ring fell out, found and put back in, stopped leaking. I don't like the design of the sealant, the ring will fail way before the rest of the cup. ============== old review ========== My 8 year old boy used this for one year, and now it leaks. He doesn't abuse it, simply from home, backpack, school and back. I included a picture to show it looks almost new, not banged up. Even if manufacturer says they would replace, who has the time to do all of that? Just making the time to write this is a stretch. Before it leaked, 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Clearly a used item!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first negative experience with Amazon warehouse deals. Ordered this thermos for soup for my daughter. Clearly someone used it, then decided to send it back! But not after they wrote their name on it in permanent marker! Not cool, Amazon. I tried to scrub it off but all it did was scratch the hell out of the lid and make the name a little less bright. I don't mind slightly damaged, but used!?!?
customer_reviews.author: Jenn W

customer_reviews.title: Good little thermos
customer_reviews.text: Great little thermos. Arrived on time as promised. Keeps a school lunch warm for about 5 hours but you have to pour boiling water in first for a few minutes to warm the thermos. Empty the water then put the food in. Only complaint is that it smelled funny. Like it had been in storage a long time. I poured a few tablespoons of baking soda and boiling water in it and left it over night. Smell gone in the morning!
customer_reviews.author: liller

customer_reviews.title: Great for school lunches
customer_reviews.text: This thermos doesn't hold much food, which makes it the perfect size for toddler lunches. My 3yo has difficulty opening it so she gets help from her teachers to do that. I am happy to report that this container doesn't leak. I used to think it has difficulty keeping food warm, but then I started pouring hot water for a few minutes before I put my food in and that seems to have solved the problem. I have not tried using it with cold foods so I have no idea how it would perform in those circumstances.
customer_reviews.author: M. Tan

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Leak proof. easy to clean .I highly recommend taking out the rubber ring every night to clean or run through the dishwasher because it grows black mold and bacteria around the inside of the ring and the lid if not cleaned every other day . Please watch for your children . I remove the ring and throw it all in the dishwasher to disinfect well with soap. Alan in all amazing product & keeps kids food hot for hours until school lunch or even we take it camping on the road ! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley DeLieto

customer_reviews.title: So awesome I bought 3 at once!
customer_reviews.text: Thermos brand is great but a little pricey. I purchased these on Prime day because they are usually $14.99 I got them for $9.99. I bought 3 because its like buying 2 at regular price. I got these for school so I can send hot lunch somedays for my girls.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal Y.

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this for his lunch. If I preheat the thermos (put boiling water in it in the morning and let it sit) and then warm the food and put it in the thermos before we leave, then my son's lunch is still warm by lunch time around 11. Otherwise it works great for his Vienna sausages for lunchtime.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy L Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids lunch!
customer_reviews.text: I love these for sending lunch to my son! Make sure to remove the plastic ring to clean the lid properly. Here’s some tricks I’ve learned that may be helpful: Boil water and let it sit inside for a few minutes with the lid on. Then empty and place your hot/warm food inside to stay warm longer. If you’re making something you don’t want to get soggy, like chicken nuggets, place a few napkins or paper towel in the bottom to help soak up the moisture. This will keep food warm for quite a few hours. My son says everything is still hot by lunch time.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Really good. My daughter was absolutely bored of cold lunches ...
customer_reviews.text: Really good. My daughter was absolutely bored of cold lunches to the point she wasn't eating them anymore, found this and decided to give it a try. I'm not a fan of school hot lunches. I rather have her eating home made food but there is not many possibilities when all you can do is cold. Currently I'm using this thermo almost every day. Keeps food warm for a good 6 hours, works perfect with pasta, soup, meatballs and even pizza. I pour some really hot water and let it sit there for a couple of minutes then throw it away and put the food in, works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: EVA SUAREZ

customer_reviews.title: Great for warm winter lunches!
customer_reviews.text: Love!!!! My sons preschool will no longer heat food now that he is in the 3 year old room. I panicked upon hearing this. THIS SAVED ME!!!! I make grilled cheese n cut it into 1/4s, mac n cheese n hot dogs, meatloaf and noodles, chicken nuggets and corn, spaghetti and meatballs, chicken soup. ITS AMAZING! My 10 year old takes soup, chili, chicken taquitos i cut in half. Phenomenal and different! I do although wish it was divided, the search continues!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping things cold & warm
customer_reviews.text: We have 7 of these food jars. I found they do a better job of keeping things cold versus hot. I put my daughter’s yogurt in hers & they stay cold all day. My son’s Mac and cheese is warm by lunch, but not steaming hot. It’s also harder to clean the Mac & cheese from it than the yogurt. They’re over all great, don’t leak when they’re closed tightly, and the cute designs make my kids happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jess18

customer_reviews.title: Got Chia Pudding?
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect size and build container for chia pudding. That is, two tablespoons of chia seeds and liquid medium (I use flax milk). For completeness, I eat this cold. I combine ingredients in the container and keep it in the fridge the night before toting to work. Just grab it and go out the door. Four hours later, I enjoy all of my still-cold chia pudding that has not at all leaked from this trusty little container. There’s still room in it for whatever you might add to it, like cacao nibs or coconut flakes. Cheerfully recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Great for food and makeup!
customer_reviews.text: Keep your lipsticks and liquid foundation from melting while enjoying a day at the beach o.r in any summer heat outing! Who knew? The creativity of women lol.
customer_reviews.author: Lady

customer_reviews.title: keep food warm for about 5hr
customer_reviews.text: like other reviews recommend, I put hot water inside with lid on while I prepare the food. Then pour out, dry out, and put the food in. Food stays warn for about 5 hr. 4yo hasn't complained about cols pot stickers, spaghetti, or broccoli yet. he can also open it on his own.
customer_reviews.author: KrisMiss

customer_reviews.title: Food cold after a few hours
customer_reviews.text: Really cute but my son complained his food was cold. My older son has a different brand lunch container - I made them both Mac n Cheese and put in their respective thermos’ at the same time (around 7:30), and they both eat lunch around 12:30. For the this thermos, my son said his food was cold. For my older son, he said his was still hot in the other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen E. Levan

customer_reviews.title: Best Thermos!!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter needed a thermos to bring warm lunch to school and we were hunting for a long time. This size is perfect for a serving of pasta or chicken and rice. We heat the thermos for 10 minutes with hot water, empty the water and dry the inside, then put the hot food inside. She eats lunch about 4 hours later and it's still nice and hot! Love the unicorn print and super easy to clean. There aren't any annoying rubber rings where mold could grow or deep crevices where food could get trapped. Will probably buy another for my husband!
customer_reviews.author: Kaeleigh K

customer_reviews.title: Great food jar that holds it temperature
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a family member that sometimes can't finish their soup or oatmeal in one sitting. This keeps the food hot for them to finish later. It's well constructed and a decent value for it's price. The heat retention isn't as good as something from Zojirushi, but it's also 1/3 the price. The cleaning instructions advise to remove the rubber o-ring when cleaning. The hard part to clean would be the lid groove interior and requiresa very small brush to reach that area. That's probably the only knock I have on this good value food jar.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Nice Thermos
customer_reviews.text: These are great small size thermoses! This is the second one we’ve purchased for our children’s lunches. The size is great for a lunch box and allows a decent potion of food for a child. I warm food up in the morning and have had no complaints about it being cold by lunchtime. We have not had any issues with leaks; however, I have not sent anything like soup. I hand wash the thermos as the directions stated in the hopes that this will prolong the seal to avoid leaking. It’s also very easy to clean. I would recommend for use with children’s lunches.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my 7 year old's school lunches. When putting macaroni and cheese, chicken nuggets or anything warm in it, I will microwave 1-2 cups of water for 2 minutes and place it in the thermos for a couple minutes, pour it out and add the food. This helps keep it pretty warm for 5-7 hours before he eats his lunch. My boss liked this idea and bought 3 for his kids lunch boxes. This is also awesome for keeping things cold as well. he will keep his veggies, fruit, or cottage cheese in it too.
customer_reviews.author: Christi

customer_reviews.title: Great Thermos for Kids
customer_reviews.text: Great thermos. Used the tip from another reviewer to put hot water in it for a few minutes to heat it up before food. This keeps the food at perfect temperature by the time lunch time comes (about 4 hours). Knocking one star because my 4 year old does have trouble eating out of it sometimes and her teacher will dump the contents into a bowl. Otherwise very happy with this purchase and would reccomend!
customer_reviews.author: ValP

customer_reviews.title: I’ll give it another try
customer_reviews.text: I’m glad I’m not the only one that experienced food not staying warm despite following directions (boil water first, pour in thermos, let sit for 5-10min, wipe dry, then add warmed food.) I put chicken nuggets in it for my son’s lunch and he reported that the nuggets were not warm by the time he ate them. :/ I wonder if it works better with certain foods. Anyhow willing to give it another go esp since my kids love spaghetti and Mac n cheese and I can always use this thermos for that type of leftovers to put in their lunch for the next school day.
customer_reviews.author: Trixie

customer_reviews.title: My son loooooves this thing!
customer_reviews.text: This thermos is awesome for a kid’s lunchbox. I’ve put re-heated leftovers in it in the morning (I just fill the thermos with hot water from the tap while the food is re-heating to pre-heat the metal inner lining), and my son says the food is still hot when he eats lunch (4 - 4.5 hours later). One day he requested Ramen for lunch, so I put boiling water in it, packed him a cup-o-noodles (along with some carrot sticks and fruit), and crossed my fingers. He said it worked great!! Now he’s bummed when I want to pack him a sandwich instead of Ramen (Insert eye roll here).
customer_reviews.author: Piper L Jornales

customer_reviews.title: Keeps food hot, not the easiest to klen
customer_reviews.text: So far it's easy to use and keeps food warm. I use the method of putting boiling water in with the lid closed for 5 minutes and heating food until steaming hot then dumping the water and immediately putting food in and closing. After 3 hours mac n cheese is 150°F. Should be 160°F for food safety but close enough for my likes. I bet it rocks for soups. It's hard for little children to open because of width and how tight it locks. Wish it had a push button or something for easy open on top. Other than that its great!
customer_reviews.author: Htomato

customer_reviews.title: Great Thermos!!
customer_reviews.text: We took this Thermos on our trip to India for our 10 month old year. We were going to be out and about a lot so we needed something to keep food warm for him (we did not store anything cold, so I cannot comment on that). We were happy that the food did stay warm for at least 7 hours, as it indicated in the product description. I think a few times it lasted for about 10 hours, so were happy about that. Overall, a great product for when you are traveling!
customer_reviews.author: Amit Patel

customer_reviews.title: Lunch saver!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has used this size Thermos to pack lunch for years! We bought the last one when she was in Kindergarten but by the time she was going into 4th grade, it was time to get rid of the "Frozen" thermos and get one a little more "grown up". I always follow the directions and keep hot water in there for 10 minutes before adding her soup. In all of these years she has never complained that her lunch was cold! My son will definitely be getting one next year when he starts kindergarten!
customer_reviews.author: Austyn

customer_reviews.title: You can't eat out of the lid
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my teen's lunch to put au jus (when we buy Arby's French dip) or something small like fruit. We have a larger 24 ounce thermos brand that my kids love. We wanted smaller. This one was really cute but was missing a very important feature. You can't pour anything into the lid. The lid is not an open cup. So you have to eat right out of the thermos itself and it's pretty narrow. Certainly can't put a french dip sandwich in it.
customer_reviews.author: RobinGBTop Contributor: Karaoke

customer_reviews.title: Won't keep hot
customer_reviews.text: I have tried various time lengths in boiling water and letting it sit inside the thermos before putting scalding hot food in it. I have yet to be able to get food to stay hot past 2 hours. =( Not acceptable for child's lunch at 11, when it is packed at 7.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Beattie

customer_reviews.title: Great for kid's lunch
customer_reviews.text: Love to use for my 6yo's lunch. She has told me that her lunch is still warm when it is her class's lunch time. I have followed some recommendations to heat up water (I just use a coffee cup & heat it for 2 min in microwave) then let it sit in container for 5 minutes before adding warm food. I haven't tried the product without doing this, so I don't know if it really makes a difference or not. My daughter loves the vibrant purple color, too!
customer_reviews.author: TiaraMarie

customer_reviews.title: Keeps food very warm
customer_reviews.text: I refuse to use the communal kitchen in my office with everything going on and I was getting so tired of cold lunches. This REALLY works. I fill it with boiling hot water and leave it while I get ready for work. Dump the water out, heat my food up super hot like 3 minutes. And it stays very warm until I'm ready for lunch around 1230 ish.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Gabb

customer_reviews.title: Easy for the kids to use at preschool
customer_reviews.text: Got this (in purple and green) for my two preschoolers... my 4 year old son told me his lunch is nice and warm each day. Very easy to clean. I never put thermoses in the dishwasher, so hand washing only and has been very easy.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Great for sending in your little’s lunch box!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this because our 5 year old refused to each school lunch and I felt bad feeding her peanut butter and jelly every day (she won’t eat lunch meat or any sort of salad sandwich). We primed this each morning as directed and at 11:30 lunch her food was still hot! I put soup, Mac and cheese, spaghetti o’s, pasta with butter (she won’t eat sauce), chicken nuggets and quesadillas and they were all perfect when she was ready to eat them!
customer_reviews.author: Briella's Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Great for a picky eater
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my kid that is a picky eater... it keeps his Mac and cheese, chicken nuggets, noodles, etc warm until lunch time... he now eats all his lunch and no food is brought home... must buy for a picky eater
customer_reviews.author: xxTashixx

customer_reviews.title: Cold by lunch
customer_reviews.text: I'm not impressed. I bought two of these because everyone raved about them. I made sure to boil water and fill it to warm the inside before putting hot food in every time. My son will not take hot food to school anymore because he says it is always cold by lunch. In the end, I would not buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Wife&MomOf4

customer_reviews.title: Great for Hot Lunches
customer_reviews.text: My son doesn't like sandwiches so lunches for school can be a challenge. With this we can send Dino Nuggets, Pasta, Mac & Cheese and multiple other things and they are still hot at lunch for him.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Gavin

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality!  Perfect for Pre-K lunch boxes
customer_reviews.text: Great thermos for toddler lunches! I place different items in the thermos for my daughters lunches...soup, macaroni, chicken nuggets-and they stay warm! I hand wash the thermos and have had no problems with leaks
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany A. Deal

customer_reviews.title: Child loves it
customer_reviews.text: My child loves when I send her lunch in this to school. So far, we have had no issues with leaks and it seems to be pretty durable as she is in Kindergarten and it has lasted for months now. I gave it 4 stars for easy to clean because the company recommend hand washing this product, even though we have been throwing it in the top rack of the dishwasher (and it is fine).
customer_reviews.author: Amber M

customer_reviews.title: Really good thermos
customer_reviews.text: I really like this thermos! We use it for our 8 year old son to take soup in for lunch at school. It stays hot from 7:30am until he goes to lunch at 11:15am. I usually soak it in hot water in a big bowl for a couple minutes before adding food. It was in the instructions to do that. No issues with it. We have been using it since the beginning of the school year around August and it still works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: BeautifulxxDisaster

customer_reviews.title: Keeps food warm, still tricky for little hands to open sometimes
customer_reviews.text: Our kindergartener has a little trouble opening it, so we can't make use of its leak proof lid to its fullest. By heating the food to super hot before it goes in, it naturally creates a vacuum as it cools, making the lid harder to get off. To help this, we have to leave the lid lightly tightened which makes it more likely to leak. Keeps food reasonably warm and cleans up okay in the dishwasher. Sometimes there's still some residue we have to hand wash but it easy enough to get clean.
customer_reviews.author: BeerWine&Cupcakes

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Last year my son carried a batman one and although it peeled it didn't start peeling after a couple of uses like this one. Also, you boil them in order for them to be warm for usage on hot food. The red bottom came off. The batman one never did that and was used way more often. Maybe this one is defective, but it is poorly made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps food warm and is leak proof
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my preschooler to take her breakfast in the morning to eat at school. Keeps food nice and warm. Love the stainless steel is easy to clean and this food jar is leak proof. I’ve put milk in it and her cereal separate in a snack bag, the milk keeps cold still when we arrive to school, so she’s able to pour the cereal in it and eat.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: The best!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I put soup for my toddler to take to school and it’s spill proof, easy to clean and holds enough for a lunch meal. Perfect for kids. A little small for adults though.
customer_reviews.author: sofya ostrak

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for my little Kindergartener! 💕
customer_reviews.text: My little one loves it. She was asking for something else besides sandwiches so i got the thermos and she loves the vary of lunch she now gets. She tells me her food is still nice and warm at lunchtime. Never had a spill or leak. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product, great for school lunches.
customer_reviews.text: This thermos food jar has been a lifesaver for school. My preschooler primarily eats warm lunches (rice dishes, pasta dishes, etc.) and due to COVID-19, we are not allowed to pack lunches that need to be microwaved in order to avoid possible cross contamination. I tested this out before school started to see how well it kept food warm. 5 hours later, and it was still warm! It also holds a very decent amount of food. Cleaning this is always a breeze. We’ve had no issues with leaking. The cute design is an added plus! So if you’re a parent like me with picky eaters who love to eat warm lunches, I highly recommend this product to you!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Raub

customer_reviews.title: Very useful and affordable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this small sized thermos to bring half & half to work... for the five cups I drink during my shift. Keeps it nice & cold.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Wong

customer_reviews.title: Great Thermos!
customer_reviews.text: This makes kiddos want to take “hot” lunches to school! Sturdy and easy to clean, so far no problems with any leaking. Just heat a cup of water to boiling in microwave, add to thermos for approx 10-15 min, pour out water and thermos is hot and will keep food warm for hours! (DO Heat your food before adding to warm thermos) A little expensive, but when your 5 year old finishes off that much for lunch... it makes Spider-Man worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Darla Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Not leak proof
customer_reviews.text: This is not leak proof and does not keep food warm for very long. I have two and they are both the same. No matter what I do they leak. Also, food bits easily get stuck to the inside and are very hard to remove. I have no idea how that happened. It's a nice size for school-aged kids, just wish it did what it claims to do.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fontaine

customer_reviews.title: Too small for us
customer_reviews.text: This container is very easy to clean, it does not leak however it does not serve the purpose I bought it for. It is a lot smaller than I expected and does not fit as much food as my child wants to eat at school. My son told me that the food Was not warm after five hours of leaving the house. I personally do not like this product to much.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Hamadi

customer_reviews.title: Hot lunch made easy
customer_reviews.text: I love these! I bought them because my daughters were soooo sick of sandwiches. Now I send soups, raviolis, pizza rolls. They love getting hot lunch, and they always tell me the food stays hot. While I'm prepping the food I pour hot hot water in them and close them up. Then dump the water add the food and perfectly hot food for my girls at lunch. The size is perfect for a lunch box and they're super easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t turn the lid to tight!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my little kindergartener! She loves it! I mostly use for rices or noodles, because I feel like nuggets will get a bit soft and soggy from the steam trapped inside! Just remember not to close the lid to tightly and have your child practice opening and closing it before you put the food in it. She said it her food stayed nice and hot!
customer_reviews.author: CeeCee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for school lunch
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old takes this to school. No problems opening or closing. It has kept the food warm even with an ice pack (I haven't tried with cold food yet). I do heat the food before I put it in the thermos. The design is cool and it's held up so far. It's easy to clean. No leaks! The compact design is nice because it allows room for additional food in the lunch bag.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna

customer_reviews.title: A hot hopeful!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 Thermos Funtainer 10 Ounce Food Jars, for my daughters because they like to eat soups and spaghetti o's for lunch at school. I like that they have different color selections so that I can differentiate the color for each child. I have noticed that food with more liquid stays hot longer than if I send spaghetti o's because there is not much liquid to keep hot, so they are eating lukewarm food, but at least it's not cold. The Thermos works for what I need it for right now. The 10 ounch works for the age group of my children at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Ed the Okie

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to expectations
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking for a container that will keep my little one’s lunch warm when she is at day care and have bought a whole lot of options which claim to fit the bill. Ofcourse, those are all money down the drain and the thermos container was the only one that did fit the bill. Live up to its name and expectations so worth the price and I’m glad I made the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Anisha Agarwala

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. My daughter insisted she needed a thermos in order to take any 'leftovers' for lunches at school. The only issue so far, as it starts to cool (says it will stay hot for up to 5 hours) the lid seems to seal more. Last time she took it to school it supposedly took 3 different adults to get it open. But no leaks and it was still hot enough for her. win-win!
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Fun, durable, and keeps the food warm!
customer_reviews.text: Kids love it for school lunch, 6 and 8 year olds find it easy to open. Keeps their food warm for 4 hours (haven't tried longer). I preheat the container with hot water while I prepare the food to help retain more heat. Tried washing it in the dishwasher, but it started dulling the container. Might just be our hard water. Lid is fine to put in dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Summertime

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for lunches
customer_reviews.text: Total lifesaver for the kids school lunches! Gives us many more options so lunch doesn’t get boring. We always heat it up at first with boiling water while I’m getting everything else ready and heating up the food that will be in it (Annie’s Mac n cheese, chicken nuggets, soup, we’ve even done French fries only had it for a couple of week but still trying new things). The kids say their food is still warm at lunchtime, I personally have tested it but they’re happy so I’m happy.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: 👍
customer_reviews.text: I got this container for my daughter to bring to school so far we love it. It keeps all of her food warm until she has lunch. I always pour hot water into the container and let it sit for 5 minutes before adding her hot food. And I take the ring around the top of it off so it doesn't grow mold.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Mayo

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter enjoy her lunch every day with this. I always put food in this at 6:30 am and this keeps food warm at least until 11:30 am and it is still warm enough! It was cheaper than zoijirushi. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t keep food as warm as I thought
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I notice my little was tired of eating sandwiches. I’ve put rice, green beans, rib bites as a meal and another meal has been nuggets and rice. I feel like neither of them were steaming hot when I opened them. Room temperature after only a few hours. I followed other reviews by adding boiling water for a few mins with the lid on. Then warming the food. As mentioned it was only room temperature, which is surprising to me. I would prefer the food to be a little warmer.
customer_reviews.author: Mardez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: The best!!! I have always gotten the rectangular containers that are suppose to keep the food warm and my kids always complained that the food was always cold. My kids love this containers they said their food is always hot. Not lukewarm they said Hot. I highly recommended. My kids’ recess is about 4:30-5 hours after I make put the food inside the containers.
customer_reviews.author: Melyssa Lopez

customer_reviews.title: It's small
customer_reviews.text: It's a great little thermos but small. I can squish a cut up grilled cheese in it. I think the size is good for a 1-4 year old's appetite at best. My 4.5 year old eats a lot and will need a bigger one for kindergarten next year. But I like this one a lot, it's not a fake, and we will be able to use it for fruit next year.
customer_reviews.author: RGreek

customer_reviews.title: Great for my daughters lunch
customer_reviews.text: My daughter uses this for her school lunches. It's nice and compact so it fights in her lunchbox perfect. She says the food is still hot when she eats lunch (5 hours after it's packed). Here's a tip: Run hot water in it to heat the cold metal inside before you put the hot food inside. She uses it everyday because she was sick of PB & J's. (really liked this at first, but the gasket on the lid already broke like a cheap rubber band
customer_reviews.author: Michael White

customer_reviews.title: Funtainers are Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these food jars - one for each of my teens. They love being able to take warm foods for lunch b/c the lines are too long to wait for microwaves during their lunch break. We follow the advice of others and pour warm water inside for a few minutes, then dump, then put in warm food. Cute colors and seem very durable. These are fabulous - would recommend to others!
customer_reviews.author: K Roz

customer_reviews.title: Thermos is a great brand
customer_reviews.text: My kids love it. I have 3 kids and they love the PJ masks : ) I have my very own Catboy (blue), Gekko (green) and Owlette (red) We purchased all 3 colors. Thermos brand is great and we received promptly. Love Amazon Prime
customer_reviews.author: Casey731

customer_reviews.title: Good size for child's lunch box/bag.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thermos specifically for my daughter's school lunches. We have other thermoses that are much too large and bulky to fit in her lunch cooler/bag and she would never eat that large amount of food anyway. This little thermos has been just the right size, it kept her chicken noodle soup hot (it does help to follow the directions of pre-heating the thermos with hot water) and she loves the bright color.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Matson

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I have used Thermos brand products in the past and have loved them. This was no different! My daughter loves to take warm food to school for lunch every day. Her Thermos is packed at 6:30 am, and when she eats lunch at 11:30 am, she says it is still warm! We have never had a problem with leakage with any of our Thermos products. the top can be a little difficult to clean because it is very narrow around the edge, but using a brush for baby bottles or one that is smaller and used to clean the rubber nipples for baby bottles should do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thermos is a great brand
customer_reviews.text: My kids love it. I have 3 kids and they love the PJ masks : ) I have my very own Catboy (blue), Gekko (green) and Owlette (red) We purchased all 3 colors. Thermos brand is great and we received promptly. Love Amazon Prime
customer_reviews.author: Casey731

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Frozen lovers hot lunch
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my Frozen loving daughter for the days she feels like taking something hot for lunch. You do have to fill them with hot water to warm up the thermos before putting the food inside, to get it up to temp. I haven't tested the heat keeping ability myself, but every time she uses them, I've asked her if her food has been hot enough and she says yes, and she hasn't gotten sick, so I'm going to assume they're doing their job. I've put them in her lunch box with an ice pack on the other side to keep other foods and drink cold and she hasn't complained of cold food in the thermos.
customer_reviews.author: Kate S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Easy to clean out, perfect for my first grade daughters lunch. She had mashed potatoes and gravy just last week in this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Durable and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this container. It keeps the food warm. Now that we’re just home, he uses to drink water in. It is so easy to clean because it has a wide opening.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great food jar!
customer_reviews.text: I love funtainer cups and this was the first food jar I'd tried. I have no idea why I didn't think to buy one earlier! My 3rd grader is so upset that he could have had hot pasta for lunch for the last few years and I was sending it to school cold! Definite purchase for school age kids, I'm just as thrilled with it as I am your funtainer cups :)
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Happy with Thermos
customer_reviews.text: Was concerned because previous thermos did not keep soup hot till lunch. This one does. TIP: Do not put base in dishwasher. Seems to reduce the ability to keep food hot. I only put lid in dishwasher. I also heat soup or chili on the stove rather than microwave . Seems to heat up better and even. I wait until the soup begins to boil small bubbles than I know it is enough. My son complained once that the soup was too hot after 5 hours. So I know the thermos is doing its job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made my son happy
customer_reviews.text: My son kept asking for a warm lunch like some of the other kids have at preschool so I finally bought this thermos container. it is easy to use, easy to clean, and easy enough for him to open. We've only put mac and cheese in it so far, so I can't confirm whether it would be leak proof but still easy to open with something like soup.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Don't lose the silicone insert in lid!!
customer_reviews.text: I loved using this product for my kid's school lunches until the silicone piece slipped out in my daughter's soup. She didn't know what it was and threw it out. The container is useless for liquids without it rendering it useless. :( I tried searching for replacement lids but can't find. Such a bummer! Going to try Hydro flask next since I'm obsessed with how they keep things cold and hot forever.
customer_reviews.author: CareninSB

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I love the flask. Wide mouth makes it easy to eat from and clean. My son's breakfast is made approximately 6:00am and is warm when he eats at 9:00 am. My only complaint is the O-ring was misplaced at school and getting the replacement is as expensive as just purchasing a new flask. Update Seem to be a bit of rust in the flask after a few months of use. Already ordered a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Wadadli Heart

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase! I have 3 and counting
customer_reviews.text: Really love this product! My little boy can eat warm food at school. I boil water to make sure is extra hot and let it sit in the thermos for as long as I can (usually 10 min) and 2 minutes before the bus comes heat up the food. He tells me his food is warm enough to be eaten :)
customer_reviews.author: Lina M. Torres

customer_reviews.title: Keeps food warm
customer_reviews.text: It’s a brand you know will work-and it does. My kid doesn’t like cold lunch and won’t eat school lunch. I’m able to pack leftovers that stay warm. The trick is put hot water in the thermos and let sit a few minutes behind filling with hot food. Food stays plenty warm by lunch time. I pack Lunches at 7 and lunch is 11:30
customer_reviews.author: Soumangue

customer_reviews.title: Great...
customer_reviews.text: Keeps hot just fine... Before putting in your food.. Boil hot water then place in thermos... Seal and let sit for 10 mins.... Dump the water, place a napkin on the bottom to soak up any moisture from the heat then place your food.. Obviously if you're adding soup do not place a napkin in the bottom..
customer_reviews.author: Nicky

customer_reviews.title: Good thermos for kids' lunchboxes - bought pack of 2 for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Got them within a week (non-Prime user). Good, quality product (better than those plastic thermoses!). Only thing is it is best to heat them up with hot water beforehand. Kids have said it's lukewarm (not hot) by their 11-1 lunch time at school. That's better than cold without a thermos. Kids use soups, mac n'cheese, potstickers, and all kinds of warmed up food in them. They are not too big or wide to take in a regular kid's lunch box, but a bigger lunchbox would be ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: This container is AMAZING. My children are able to take soup
customer_reviews.text: This container is AMAZING. My children are able to take soup, their 'spaghetti o's', and anything else they can fit into it, to school and have it still be warm by lunch time. It is important to fill it with hot water prior to adding your heated food to the container. It isn't all that big so a whole can of soup or the like does not fit. However, it serves its purpose, therefore earning the stars.
customer_reviews.author: L.Will

customer_reviews.title: Smart purchase for back to school lunches!
customer_reviews.text: I seriously don't know why I waited so long to buy this thing. I thought my kid would be fine on PB&J, but she eventually got bored with them and I realized I had to change up her school lunch. This morning was her first hot lunch since school started and she was so excited to have hot lunch that she could hardly contain herself. She loves her dinosaur chicken nuggets and I was able to fit them perfectly in her new thermos. I made sure to follow the instructions to pre-heat the container with hot water first to allow it to stay warmer, longer. This was a smart purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Banji Lou Who

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for school lunches
customer_reviews.text: This product has doubled the options we have for sending out kids to school with lunches. Now pasta, meatballs, and other similar items are do-able. We fill it with some hot sink water for several minutes to get it up to temp before putting the hot food in and our kids report that the food is pleasantly warm at lunchtime. My only gripe is that our boys have managed to leave these at school twice and they’ve been lost, but I know who to blame for that. It’s a great product and sized just right for a grade schooler’s main course.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for School Lunches
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our Kindergartner. It's big enough to fit a substantial serving and compact enough to fit in his lunchbox. It doesn't have a second inner cap so it's easier for him to open/close and doesn't appear to leak. Has kept food same temperature for at least 5 hours. We tried hot water and left it overnight, 9 hours later it was still warm.
customer_reviews.author: cox

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This container is the perfect addition to our sons lunch box. I’m able to send hot foods in here and they will still be warm at lunchtime for him. Cleaning it is so simple and it matches the water bottle we purchased. No leaking issues at all so far!
customer_reviews.author: Marla M Williamson

product_meta.title: Thermos Funtainer 10 Ounce Food Jar, Blue
product_meta.description: Color:Blue| Style:Food JarThermos products deliver what matters every time. As the leading manufacturer of convenient insulated products for over 100 years, Thermos is trusted by consumers to provide innovative portable containers that promote a safe and healthy lifestyle. Thermos delivers when it matters. Thermos brand products offer superior insulation that keeps food at its maximum temperature retention for hours, and the 10 Ounce FUNtainer food jar is no exception. Thermos Vacuum insulation technology virtually eliminates temperature change within the beverage container by creating an airless space between two stainless steel walls. The result is an insulation layer that performs better than any other. A superior insulated container you can depend on to keep your child's food hot or cold for longer. This food jar keeps food cold up to 7 hours and hot for 5 hours. Constructed with double wall stainless steel, this 10 ounce food jar is built to withstand the demands of everyday use with its durable stainless steel interior and exterior and features a wide mouth that is easy to fill, serve from and clean. In order to maximize the incredible insulation technology, it is recommended to pre-chill or pre-heat the jar just prior to use.
feature_bullets: THERMOS vacuum insulation technology for maximum temperature retention, hot or cold
Durable stainless steel interior and exterior
Wide mouth is easy to fill, serve from and clean
Keeps cold for 7 hours and hot for 5 hours; stay cool exterior
10 ounce capacity; hand washing is recommended

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
